Permanent large-file storage for Git teams

git-arweave-lfs brings Git LFS workflows to the decentralized web. Track, push, and clone large assets backed by Arweave's permanent storage without changing the way your team works.

View on GitHub Get Started 
git arweave-lfs install
git arweave-lfs config set-wallet ~/wallet.json

git arweave-lfs track "*.zip"
git add build/archive.zip
git commit -m "Store build artifacts permanently"

Why teams choose git-arweave-lfs

Built to feel like Git LFS, with the added benefit of Arweave's tamper-proof, permanent storage and Turbo-backed uploads.

Git LFS-compatible workflow

Install once, track patterns, and push large files with the same commands you already use in Git LFS.

Permanent Arweave storage

Back large assets with Arweave's permanent, decentralized data layer—no more expired links or missing binaries.

Wallet-free clones

Developers can clone and pull repositories without configuring a wallet, removing onboarding friction.

Efficient uploads via ArDrive Turbo

Upload files quickly and reliably with Turbo acceleration while preserving verifiability on-chain.

Granular deduplication

Pointer files mirror Git LFS, avoiding redundant uploads and keeping repositories lean.

First-class CLI tooling

Track patterns, configure wallets, and manage filters using intuitive `git arweave-lfs` subcommands.

Install in minutes

git-arweave-lfs installs globally, then works in any repository you clone. 

# One-time setup
git arweave-lfs install
git arweave-lfs config set-wallet /path/to/wallet.json

# Track files in any repo
git arweave-lfs track "*.zip"
git add large-file.zip

# Clone and pull without a wallet
git clone https://github.com/you/repo.git

How it works

Pointer files keep your Git history lean, while the clean/smudge filters interact with Arweave. Uploads leverage ArDrive Turbo for speed, and downloads use the public gateway so developers can clone without a wallet. References are stored in `repository/.git/info/arweave-lfs-refs.json` to avoid duplicate uploads.

Ready for production

The CLI mirrors Git LFS, uses native Git configuration, and offers wallet-free read-only operations. It's optimized for DX with descriptive errors, smart caching, and deterministic builds.
